definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: "Thank you for sending me a copy of your book; I'll waste no time reading it. " —Moses Hadas.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您送我的大作樣書，我不會浪費時間拜讀的。

sentences.english: I've read your article and I expected to see an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我拜讀過您的大作，並且期望看見一個老一點的人。

sentences.english: By the time Haggis began reading it, “Dianetics” had sold about two and a half million copies.
sentences.chinese: 當哈吉斯拜讀此書時，它已經賣出了250萬本。

sentences.english: You are very successful in Spain. We all read about it.
sentences.chinese: 你在板鴨很成功啊，我們都拜讀了。

sentences.english: We have read your article. We expect to meet an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我們拜讀過你的大作，沒想到你竟然這麼年輕。

sentences.english: I have read your article. I expected to meet an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我拜讀過您的大作，沒想到您這麼年輕。

sentences.english: I have read your new book.
Of all the French writers that I have read, I like Molière and Racine best.
sentences.chinese: 在我所拜讀過的法國作家中，我最喜歡莫里哀和拉辛。

sentences.english: What is the significance of reading the gosho ?
sentences.chinese: 拜讀御書的意義是什麼？

sentences.english: Today, as we re-read these two articles, we are even more deeply moved.
sentences.chinese: 現在，重新拜讀兩篇雜文，更加讓人百感交集。

sentences.english: I have read your article . I expect to meet an older man. ( adj .
sentences.chinese: 拜讀了你的大作，沒想到你這樣年輕。

sentences.english: I have read your article. I expect to meet an older man.
sentences.chinese: 拜讀了你的大作，沒想到你這樣年輕。

definition: to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
random thoughts/(in book titles etc) impressions/jottings
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
